sources.data_found: CSE Department About Page: States enrollment of 'over 1,300 undergraduate majors, 400 master's students, and 160 PhD students'.
RIS Service Description: States the Compute Platform consists of approximately 25,000 CPU cores and 50+ GPU nodes.
CHPC provides access to over 2,500 CPU cores and over 80 NVIDIA A100 and H100 GPUs.
Facility maintains H100, A100 (80G/40G) SXM and PCIe nodes.
A&S Condo consists of nodes containing 8 NVIDIA Ampere A100, PCIe, 80GB GPUs.
Compute2 basic infrastructure statistics include 64 Nvidia H100 GPUs.
Compute2 GPU compute nodes listed as c2-gpu-[001-018] with NVIDIA H100 80GB HBM3.
RCIF/CHPC node table lists GPU nodes: gpuh (H100 SXM), gpua (A100 SXM), gpugh01 (GH200).
Engineering Research Compute Cluster lists A100 SXM4, A100 PCIe, and A40 GPUs.

student_data.notes: Counts taken explicitly from the CSE Department 'About Us' page (Gemini). Other models estimated lower counts based on degrees awarded or found no data. Figures are: >1,300 undergraduate majors, 400 master's students, and 160 PhD students.

gpu_resources.notes:
High counts derived from aggregating multiple clusters (RIS Compute2, RCIF/CHPC, Engineering LSF, and A&S Condo). 
- H100 PCIe: 64 listed in RIS Compute2 docs (OpenAI).
- H100 SXM: 40 estimated by Claude from CHPC resources (OpenAI found 8 explicitly in RCIF).
- GH200: 1 node identified in RCIF.
- A100 80GB: 48 total (Agreed upon by Gemini/OpenAI analysis of Engineering + A&S + RCIF).
- A100 40GB: 52 total (RCIF cluster).
- V100: 141 total (120 from RIS base system + 21 from RCIF).

analysis_notes: Ensemble result aggregated from OpenAI, Claude, and Gemini models. Student counts prioritize department-stated enrollment over degree-based estimates. GPU counts represent a sum of disparate systems (RIS, RCIF, Engineering) using the highest identified values for each specific hardware type.
validation_notes: No changes made. All GPU resources appear to be locally owned and operated by Washington University in St. Louis. Student data is complete and accurate.
